page.title: 20SUNDAY ACTIVITIES
page.content: THE CHILDREN TOLD US THAT ON SUNDAYS THEY PLAYED WITH TOYS OR FRIENDS, WENT BIKE-RIDES OR WALKS, VISITED RELATIVES WENT SWIMMING, DID HOUSEWORK, WENT TO MAJORETTES, CLEANED PETS OUT, LISTENED TO THE RADIO OR WATCHED TELEVISION. WE TOLD THE VICAR WHAT WE HAD FOUND OUT AND ASKED HIM WHY HE THOUGHT SO FEW CHILDREN WENT TO CHURCH. WE ASKED HIM IF HE COULD SEE THINGS GETTING ANY BETTER AND HE SAID THAT HE GOT BETWEEN 20 AND 30 CHILDREN AT SERVICES INCLUDING THOSE IN THE CHOIR AND HE SUPPOSED THAT UNLESS PARENTS EXPLAINED THINGS TO THEM THEY WOULD FIND IT BORING. HE COULD NOT SEE THINGS CHANGING MUCH AND HE HAD NO PLANS FOR DOING ANYTHING DIFFERENT TO GET MORE PEOPLE TO COME. WE ASKED HIM IF HE LIKED VISITING OUR SCHOOL AND HE SAID,"NO, NOT REALLY," SO WE TOLD HIM WE WOULD LIKE TO SEE HIM MORE OFTEN.
